_vision_explanations:Header & Dates:c5da.1: This is the form title 'Resident Registration Change Form' - you don't need to fill anything here as it's just the header identifying the type of form.
_vision_explanations:Header & Dates:c5da.2: This is a subtitle indicating the form also serves as a residence address notification - again, this is just informational text and requires no input from you.

_vision_explanations:Who Is Filing:e0b42.3: Check this box if you are filing a notification for changes to late-stage elderly medical care (typically for those 75 and older). This is only relevant if the form involves elderly medical care status changes.
_vision_explanations:Who Is Filing:e0b42.5: Check this box if you are moving into this municipality from another city/town in Japan or from abroad. This indicates you are registering as a new resident coming from outside the current jurisdiction.
_vision_explanations:Who Is Filing:e0b42.9: This field appears to contain corrupted or unreadable characters in the image. You should refer to the original form or contact the municipal office for clarification on what should be entered here.

_vision_explanations:Who Is Filing:45540.2: Check this box if you will provide your personal number (My Number). As a foreign resident with a My Number card or notification, you should typically check this box and provide your 12-digit My Number in the designated field on the form.

_vision_explanations:Addresses:9fbbff360.3: This appears to be a field for additional address information or apartment/building details. Write your apartment number, building name, or room number if applicable.
_vision_explanations:Addresses:9fbbff360.5: This field seems to be for postal code or zip code. Enter your 7-digit Japanese postal code in the format 000-0000.
_vision_explanations:Addresses:9fbbff360.12: This appears to be requesting your individual number (My Number). Enter your 12-digit individual identification number if you have been assigned one as a resident.

_vision_explanations:Addresses:d8f17afcc.9: Write the sequential number or identifier for this address entry if you have multiple addresses listed on the form. If this is your only or primary address, you can typically write '1' or leave it blank if not required.

_vision_explanations:Addresses:104a75963.10: This field asks whether you need to return any items when moving out of your current address (有 = yes, 無 = no). Most foreign residents should circle 無 (no) unless you have specific government-issued items like a senior citizen card or disability card that need to be returned to the municipal office.

_vision_explanations:Person Table:2ce640.3: Select '有' (yes) or '無' (no) to indicate whether you are moving out of the municipality. If moving out, you may need to provide a collection number for when you turn in your resident card. Foreign residents should select '有' if moving to a different city/ward and '無' if staying in the same municipality.

As a foreign resident, you would typically check the appropriate box for your situation: '転入' for moving into the ward, '転出' for moving out, '転居' for moving within the ward, or '世帯変更' for household changes like marriage or family composition changes.

_vision_explanations:Header & Dates:a5d0.3: This is just a descriptive header explaining that this form also serves as a National Health Insurance qualification loss notification and elderly medical care liaison form - no action needed, it's informational only.
_vision_explanations:Header & Dates:a5d0.4: This indicates the form is addressed to the Mayor of Nerima Ward - this is pre-printed text showing who will receive your form, so you don't need to write anything here.

_vision_explanations:Who Is Filing:45ed9.3: Write the date when you moved out or plan to move out of your previous address in the Reiwa era format (Japanese calendar). If you're unsure of the Reiwa year, subtract 2018 from the Western year (e.g., 2024 = Reiwa 6).

_vision_explanations:Addresses:9762ff0f9.9: This appears to be part of an address field where you would write the second character of a katakana place name or building name. If your address contains katakana characters (often used for foreign place names or modern building names), write the appropriate katakana character here following the sequence from the previous boxes.

_vision_explanations:Person Table:53f863.6: This section provides guidance about special moving-out procedures (特例転出). If you're moving to another municipality in Japan, you may be eligible for a simplified process where you don't need to submit a moving-out notification in person - instead you can complete the process at your new address. Check the boxes or follow instructions if this special procedure applies to your move.

_vision_explanations:Person Table:acc8bb.9: This checkbox is for people who are moving out of Japan and need a special moving-out certificate (tokureiten-shutsu). Check this box only if you are permanently leaving Japan and need the certificate for overseas procedures - most temporary moves within Japan should leave this unchecked.

_vision_explanations:Person Table:eb7b37.7: Check this box if you want to use the special moving-out procedure (特例転出) which allows you to complete your move-out notification without visiting the municipal office in person. This is typically used when moving to another municipality within Japan and can simplify the moving process.

_vision_explanations:Person Table:b1b7e3.1: Check this box only if you are moving out of Japan temporarily and want to use the special departure procedure to suspend your resident registration.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:b1b7e3.7: This is an informational section that lists what documents you need to include with your application - read it carefully but no action needed here.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:b1b7e3.14: These are selection checkboxes for various options or categories - check the appropriate boxes based on your specific situation as indicated by the form instructions.

_vision_explanations:Person Table:771e15.1: Check the box for '自宅' (home) if you want documents sent to your home address, or '2 返信用封筒' if you're providing a return envelope. Foreign residents moving abroad or doing special move-out procedures don't need to provide a return envelope.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:771e15.5: If using a return envelope option, write the destination address clearly and attach proper postage stamps. This envelope will be used to send your moving-out certificate back to you.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:771e15.12: Fill this out only if the head of household is moving out but other family members are staying in the same household. Indicate who will become the new head of household among the remaining members.

_vision_explanations:Person Table:03c392.8: This field is for data entry personnel to initial or stamp after inputting your information into the government system. Leave this blank - it will be completed by the processing staff.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:03c392.12: This is for verification staff to sign or stamp after cross-checking your submitted information against other records. Leave this blank as it's for internal government use only.

_vision_explanations:Header & Dates:3096.5: Check this box or field when you have completed all required notifications to relevant government offices (such as city hall, tax office, etc.) related to your move. This indicates you have fulfilled all administrative reporting requirements for your address change.

_vision_explanations:Who Is Filing:5e415.1: This is a pre-printed header addressing the form to the Mayor of Bunkyo Ward - you don't need to write anything here. This indicates that this form is specifically for residents of Bunkyo Ward in Tokyo to submit to the ward office.

_vision_explanations:ID & Documents:0863.11: Check this box if you are moving into this municipality from another city/town in Japan or from abroad. This is typically used when registering your new address after relocating to establish residency in the new location.

_vision_explanations:Header & Dates:8a64.2: This shows the form version/date (R07.02 = Reiwa 7, February = 2025 February). You don't need to write anything here as it's pre-printed.
_vision_explanations:Header & Dates:8a64.4: This is the form title indicating it's a combined notification for residence registration, national health insurance, pension, and long-term care. No action needed as it's pre-printed.
_vision_explanations:Header & Dates:8a64.5: This addresses the form to the Mayor of Edogawa Ward. Leave this pre-printed text as is - no writing required.
_vision_explanations:Header & Dates:8a64.7: Check this box if you're combining households or moving in from areas with postal codes 30-46. Only check if this specific situation applies to you.
_vision_explanations:Header & Dates:8a64.8: Check this box if you're moving into this municipality from another city/town in Japan or from abroad. This is the most common option for foreign residents.
_vision_explanations:Header & Dates:8a64.11: This note states that for moving-in procedures, you don't need to fill out the notification form details. Read this instruction but don't write anything here.
_vision_explanations:Header & Dates:8a64.15: Check this box only if you're moving to a new address within the same municipality (Edogawa Ward). Don't check if moving from outside the ward.

_vision_explanations:Who Is Filing:366b1.2: This is an informational notice stating that if you're moving into this municipality from another city or from abroad, you don't need to fill out the transfer-in portion of this form - it will be handled automatically.
_vision_explanations:Who Is Filing:366b1.6: Check this box if you're moving to a new address within the same municipality (same city/town/ward). This is for local moves only, not moves from other cities.
_vision_explanations:Who Is Filing:366b1.8: Enter the date of your move in the Japanese Reiwa era format (令和 year, month, day). Check the 転出 (moving out) box if you're moving away from this municipality to another city.
_vision_explanations:Who Is Filing:366b1.12: These are special circumstances checkboxes - 特例転入 is for special transfer-in cases, 世帯主変更 is for changing the head of household, and 照合 is for verification purposes. Only check if these specific situations apply to you.

_vision_explanations:Who Is Filing:87c0e.1: Check the appropriate box if you're moving out of Japan (特例転出), if this is an official correction (職権修正), or other circumstances (その他). Most foreign residents moving abroad would check 特例転出.

_vision_explanations:Who Is Filing:d6470.1: A 'moving out notification' (転出届) is required when you move your residence across different cities, towns, or villages.
_vision_explanations:Who Is Filing:d6470.2: When you submit the moving out notification, a 'moving out certificate' (転出証明書) will be issued for you to complete your moving in registration at your new address location.
_vision_explanations:Who Is Filing:d6470.3: The moving out notification can be submitted by mail, so please send it to the Chiyoda Ward office at the address shown below.
_vision_explanations:Who Is Filing:d6470.4: It takes approximately 1 week to 10 days for the moving out certificate to reach you. Once you receive it, take it to your new city/town/village office and complete your moving in procedures.
_vision_explanations:Who Is Filing:d6470.6: Check this if you are someone who needs various certificates after submitting your moving out notification - this applies if you might need official documents from your previous address after moving.

_vision_explanations:Person Table:4d6682.2: This is informational text continuing from point 1, explaining that you must complete the moving-out procedure within 14 days of your scheduled moving date or your card will become invalid. No action required to fill this out.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:4d6682.5: This is an informational bullet point warning that after submitting your moving-out notification, you won't be able to obtain certificates like residence certificates at convenience stores. No action required to fill this out.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:4d6682.6: This is informational text advising that if you need certificates, you should visit the ward office or branch office by the day before your scheduled moving date. No action required to fill this out.

_vision_explanations:Who Is Filing:13269.5: Enter the date you actually moved to your new address (when you started living there), not the date you're filing this form. Use the Japanese date format: year, month, day.
_vision_explanations:Who Is Filing:13269.8: Enter today's date - the actual date you're submitting this moving notification form to the city office. This must be within 14 days of your move date.
_vision_explanations:Who Is Filing:13269.15: Check this box if you are moving out of the city by your own choice (voluntary move), which applies to most foreign residents changing addresses for work, housing, or personal reasons.

_vision_explanations:Who Is Filing:d2a2e.2: Check this box if you are moving out of your current municipality and need special moving-out procedures (typically for overseas moves or certain domestic relocations).
_vision_explanations:Who Is Filing:d2a2e.3: Check the appropriate reason box for your move - common options include job transfer, marriage, study, or personal reasons. Only select one option that best describes your situation.
_vision_explanations:Who Is Filing:d2a2e.4: Check this box if you are moving out and specifically need a certificate of moving-out (転出証明書) issued to you, which you'll typically need when registering at your new address.
_vision_explanations:Who Is Filing:d2a2e.5: Check this box if you are moving into Chuo City from another municipality within Japan (domestic move between different cities/wards).

_vision_explanations:Addresses:28b17f584.1: Check the appropriate box that matches your moving situation - whether you're moving into Chuo City from elsewhere in Japan, moving within Chuo City, or moving out of Chuo City.
_vision_explanations:Addresses:28b17f584.2: Check this box only if you're moving out of Chuo City and want to receive a moving-out certificate (転出証明書) which you'll need to register at your new municipality.
_vision_explanations:Addresses:28b17f584.3: Check this box if you're moving into Chuo City from another municipality within Japan (not from abroad).
_vision_explanations:Addresses:28b17f584.6: This appears to be a blank field for additional information - leave blank unless instructed otherwise or if you need to provide supplementary details about your move.
_vision_explanations:Addresses:28b17f584.7: Check this box if you're moving out of Chuo City to another location in Japan or to another country.

_vision_explanations:Person Table:969c25.6: Write your complete new address in Japan, including prefecture, city, ward, district, and apartment/building details if applicable. Make sure it matches exactly with your housing contract or residence confirmation.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:969c25.8: Check this box only if your new address is exactly the same as what's written on your moving-out certificate (転出証明書) from your previous city/ward office. If you don't have this certificate or the addresses differ, leave it unchecked.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:969c25.12: Do not write anything in this section - it's reserved for ward office staff to fill out administrative notes and processing information.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:969c25.14: Leave these columns completely blank as they are for official use only by government employees during processing.

_vision_explanations:Person Table:1e6e53.8: Write your date of birth in the Japanese format: year (using Japanese era system like Reiwa, Heisei, etc.), month, and date. If unsure about the Japanese era year, you can convert your Western calendar birth year or ask for assistance - for example, 1990 would be Heisei 2.

_vision_explanations:Person Table:5a4fd0.1: Enter the date you are moving or registering in Year/Month/Day format using Japanese calendar or Western calendar as specified on the form.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:5a4fd0.7: Check this box if your moving-out certificate (転出証明書) contains the same information as what you're entering in this section - this helps avoid duplicate data entry.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:5a4fd0.9: Check this box if the information matches your moving-out certificate exactly - this is a verification step to ensure consistency between documents.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:5a4fd0.10: Use this blank field to write any additional information or special circumstances related to your move that don't fit in the standard fields above.

_vision_explanations:Who Is Filing:e1f9f.5: This field asks for your new address where you will be living going forward. Include the apartment/mansion name and room number if applicable, writing clearly in Japanese characters or romaji as accepted by your local office.

_vision_explanations:Person Table:686375.4: Write your residential code (住民票コード) - a 11-digit number assigned to residents. If you don't know it, you can leave this blank or write '記入不要' (not required to fill in).
_vision_explanations:Person Table:686375.7: Enter your new resident card number (在留カード番号). This is the number printed on your residence card that foreign residents must carry.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:686375.14: Write your previous residential code if you had one at your former address. Foreign residents can leave this blank if unknown or if this is your first registration in Japan.

_vision_explanations:Person Table:74dee6.4: This appears to be a blank field for additional information or notes. Leave blank unless specifically instructed by the office staff or if you need to provide supplementary details about your application.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:74dee6.15: This section is for administrative processing by government staff regarding various insurance systems (national health insurance, pension, long-term care, etc.). As an applicant, you should leave this section blank as it will be filled out by the processing office.

_vision_explanations:ID & Documents:6275.5: This is an input field where you enter or select the specific information being requested on the form. Check what type of data is required (name, address, date, etc.) and fill it in accurately using the appropriate format.
_vision_explanations:ID & Documents:6275.13: This refers to official record books or registers maintained by the government office. You typically don't fill this in yourself - it's for administrative use by the office staff to indicate which official records need to be updated or referenced.

_vision_explanations:Addresses:9054c2df5.7: Check the box for your identification document type - most foreign residents should check '個人番号カード' (Individual Number Card/My Number Card) if you have one, or '住基カードB' (Basic Resident Registration Card B) if applicable.
_vision_explanations:Addresses:9054c2df5.13: This appears to be a reference section for various official documents and systems. You typically don't need to fill this out yourself - it's for administrative reference by the office processing your form.

_vision_explanations:Person Table:816ccd.2: This appears to be a complex administrative reference section - likely leave blank unless you have specific case numbers or reference codes provided by the government office. Foreign residents should ask the staff for guidance on whether this section applies to their situation.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:816ccd.7: This is a parenthetical field for additional information or clarification - write any supplementary details in Japanese characters or leave blank if no additional information is needed.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:816ccd.8: This is a blank field for writing in specific information - fill in the requested details using appropriate Japanese characters (hiragana, katakana, or kanji as appropriate).
_vision_explanations:Person Table:816ccd.10: This is another administrative reference section similar to field 2 - typically left blank unless you have specific document reference numbers or codes from previous government correspondence.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:816ccd.13: Circle either '有' (yes/have) or '無' (no/don't have) depending on whether you possess the referenced documents or meet the specified conditions, then check the appropriate boxes that follow.

_vision_explanations:Person Table:2d2e21.2: Write your full name in katakana in the first parentheses and any alternate reading or romanized name in the second parentheses if needed. Foreign residents should use the katakana version of their name as registered with immigration.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:2d2e21.4: This appears to be a reference code or case number section - leave blank unless you have been specifically assigned a reference number by the issuing office. If this is a response to previous correspondence, check any reference numbers on prior documents you received.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:2d2e21.11: Write your full name in katakana in the first parentheses and any alternate reading in the second parentheses if applicable. This should match exactly with your residence card registration.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:2d2e21.15: This is another reference code section that should typically be left blank unless you are responding to a specific case or have been given a reference number to include. Check any instruction letters or previous correspondence for reference numbers to enter here.

_vision_explanations:Header & Dates:a7b3.3: This section is for proxy information - only fill this out if someone else is submitting this form on your behalf. If you're filing the form yourself, leave this section blank.
_vision_explanations:Header & Dates:a7b3.4: Write the full name of the person moving residence. Use the checkboxes if this person's name is the same as either the new or previous household head to avoid writing it twice.

_vision_explanations:Who Is Filing:4e718.1: This section is for when someone else is filing the form on your behalf as a proxy/representative. If you're filing for yourself, you can leave this blank.
_vision_explanations:Who Is Filing:4e718.2: Write your full name here. If your name is the same as either the new or previous household head mentioned elsewhere on the form, you can check the appropriate box instead of writing it out again.
_vision_explanations:Who Is Filing:4e718.7: Check this box if your address is the same as a previous address already written elsewhere on this form. This saves you from having to write out the full address again.

_vision_explanations:Addresses:a78dfb553.6: Fill in this section only for household members who are transferring their National Health Insurance (NHI) registration along with their address change. Leave blank if no one is transferring NHI coverage.
_vision_explanations:Addresses:a78dfb553.9: Enter the date when your My Number Card was issued and indicate your relationship to the household head (self, spouse, child, etc.). Check YES or NO for whether you want your My Number Card registered.
_vision_explanations:Addresses:a78dfb553.14: Check the boxes for any relevant documents you're submitting, such as social insurance cards, postal savings books, or other identification documents. Most foreign residents should check the passport and residence card boxes.
_vision_explanations:Addresses:a78dfb553.15: Write your birth year in the parentheses and circle either M (male) or F (female) to indicate your gender.

_vision_explanations:Person Table:6fb534.1: Circle M for male or F for female to indicate your gender. This is a standard demographic field required on most Japanese government forms.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:6fb534.5: Check the boxes that apply to your documentation needs - this appears to be a checklist for various government services like social insurance enrollment, address registration, or document requests. Foreign residents should check boxes relevant to their visa status and required services.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:6fb534.6: Circle M for male or F for female to indicate your gender. This appears to be for a second person if filling out a family or household form.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:6fb534.11: Check the boxes that apply to your documentation needs - this is another service checklist section. Select services you need such as residence card updates, tax documentation, or other administrative procedures.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:6fb534.13: Circle M for male or F for female to indicate your gender. This would be for a third person listed on the form, likely for family applications.

_vision_explanations:Person Table:89a62e.4: This appears to be a status/category selection row with checkboxes for various document types or statuses. Check the boxes that apply to your situation regarding social insurance, address, transportation, education, or document requests.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:89a62e.5: Select your gender by circling either M (Male) or F (Female). The (Y) likely refers to year of birth which should be filled in the space provided.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:89a62e.6: Circle YES or NO for whether you need care/nursing services recognition, and check any applicable boxes for the various document types or services you're requesting.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:89a62e.9: Similar to field 4, this is another status/category row. Check the appropriate boxes for your document requests or status regarding social insurance, postal matters, assets, transportation, education, etc.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:89a62e.10: This is the Reception Number field - leave this blank as it will be filled in by the office staff when you submit your application.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:89a62e.11: Same as field 5 - circle M or F for gender and fill in the year (Y) in the designated space.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:89a62e.14: This section is specifically for Residence Certificate applications. Fill this out only if you need a residence certificate, and note that if you're not a household member, you'll need a proxy letter.

_vision_explanations:Person Table:b0db88.1: Select 'Yes' if you want items like your nationality, visa status, or residence card number to be hidden from your Certificate of Residence, or 'No' if you want all standard information displayed. Most foreign residents choose 'No' unless they have specific privacy concerns about certain personal details being visible on official documents.

_vision_explanations:ID & Documents:301d.1: Select 'Yes' if you want your legal domicile/family head information listed on your Certificate of Residence, or 'No' if you don't want it shown. Most foreign residents select 'No' unless specifically required by their employer or organization.
_vision_explanations:ID & Documents:301d.4: Click this button to submit your Certificate of Residence application after completing all required fields. Make sure you've double-checked all information before submitting.
_vision_explanations:ID & Documents:301d.5: Write the specific purpose for requesting this certificate (e.g. 'employment', 'visa application', 'bank account opening') and indicate who you're submitting it to (e.g. company name, government office). Be specific as this helps determine what information should be included on the certificate.

_vision_explanations:Footer & Notes:e017.5: This is an informational notice for Japanese citizens moving abroad, not a field to fill out. Foreign residents can skip this section as it doesn't apply to them.
_vision_explanations:Footer & Notes:e017.8: This references additional information about using My Number cards overseas and is not a field to complete. Foreign residents should refer to the Itabashi ward website for details if planning to move abroad.

_vision_explanations:Other Fields:ab859f.8: This indicates the form revision date (December 2, 2024 in the Reiwa era) - you don't need to fill this out as it's printed information.
_vision_explanations:Other Fields:ab859f.9: This shows the page number (Page 1) - this is also printed information that you don't need to fill out.

_vision_explanations:Person Table:a0d994.5: Write the name of your city, town, or village (市町村名). This is the municipal level of your new address - for example, if moving to Shibuya ward in Tokyo, you would write '渋谷区'.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:a0d994.6: Write the name of your prefecture or metropolitan area (都道府県名). This is the higher administrative level - for example, '東京都' for Tokyo, '大阪府' for Osaka Prefecture, or '神奈川県' for Kanagawa Prefecture.

_vision_explanations:ID & Documents:dd32.3: This is an informational section explaining important rules - you don't need to write anything here. It states that the person listed must submit the form themselves, and that representatives or other people cannot submit it for postal transfers.

_vision_explanations:ID & Documents:848a.5: Write the names and birth dates of all family members who are moving out of the current address. Include everyone listed on your current residence certificate (住民票) who will be relocating, even if they are moving to different destinations.

_vision_explanations:Instructions:b27811.2: This instruction tells you to include your residence card or My Number card in an envelope and dispose of it properly after your move-out procedures are complete. As a foreign resident, make sure to follow the proper disposal procedures for important identity documents as instructed by your local municipality.

_vision_explanations:Footer & Notes:115f.1: This is a declaration statement meaning 'I hereby submit the above notification.' You don't need to write anything here - it's just confirming you're submitting the form as stated.
_vision_explanations:Footer & Notes:115f.8: This is an informational note directing you to check the ward office website for details about continuing to use your My Number card while living abroad. No action needed - just for reference if you plan to move overseas.

_vision_explanations:Other Fields:ecb692.4: This indicates the form revision date (October 13, 2024) and is pre-printed - you don't need to write anything here. This helps ensure you're using the current version of the form.

_vision_explanations:Header & Dates:f6e1.1: This is the form title 'Resident Registration Change Form' (住民異動届) - you don't need to write anything here as it's just the header identifying what type of form this is.

_vision_explanations:Person Table:68d538.2: Circle '有' (yes) if you are moving out of this address, or '無' (no) if you are not moving. If moving out, you may need to provide a collection number from the municipal office.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:68d538.13: Circle '有' (yes) if you are moving out of this address, or '無' (no) if you are not moving. If moving out, you may need to provide a collection number from the municipal office.

_vision_explanations:Instructions:d6b6dc.1: Check the box for map verification if you need property boundary confirmation. For identity verification, check the appropriate box for national health insurance documents you're bringing or need assistance with.
_vision_explanations:Instructions:d6b6dc.10: Check this box if you need documentation for later-stage elderly medical care (age 75+) or if you need a residence certificate (juminhyo) which proves your registered address in Japan.

_vision_explanations:Instructions:9a617a.1: Select '全' (all) if applying for all family members, or '一' if applying for just one person. Foreign residents typically select based on whether they need documents for their entire registered household or just themselves.
_vision_explanations:Instructions:9a617a.2: Check this box if you need a certificate showing acceptance of notification for moving out. This is required when moving from one municipality to another in Japan.
_vision_explanations:Instructions:9a617a.3: Check this box if you need your residence card information recorded on the certificate. This is useful for foreign residents who need proof of their current address and status.
_vision_explanations:Instructions:9a617a.4: Check this box to return your old seal registration certificate when getting a new one. Required when updating your registered seal (inkan) information.
_vision_explanations:Instructions:9a617a.5: Check this box if you need a certificate proving your registered seal. This official document verifies that your personal seal is registered with the municipality.
_vision_explanations:Instructions:9a617a.6: Check this box if you need a certificate of special permanent residency. This applies specifically to special permanent residents (typically Korean and Taiwanese residents with historical ties to Japan).
_vision_explanations:Instructions:9a617a.7: Check this box if you need a disability handbook. This is for residents applying for or updating official disability status documentation.
_vision_explanations:Instructions:9a617a.8: Check this box if you need health insurance qualification confirmation documents. This proves your enrollment in the national health insurance system.
_vision_explanations:Instructions:9a617a.9: Check this box and specify in the parentheses if you need any other type of certificate not listed above. Write the specific document name you need.

_vision_explanations:Footer & Notes:18a3.1: This appears to be a checkbox or selection field where you should mark '一' (one/single) or '全' (all) depending on whether you're applying for one specific item or all applicable items from the form categories.
_vision_explanations:Footer & Notes:18a3.6: This is the form version date (January 5, 2026, Reiwa 8) - you don't need to write anything here as it's pre-printed information indicating when this version of the form was last revised.

_vision_explanations:Header & Dates:ddfa.1: This is an instruction header - you don't need to write anything here. Simply read and understand that you must carefully follow all the form instructions.
_vision_explanations:Header & Dates:ddfa.3: This is also an instruction - don't write anything in this field. Use only permanent ink (ballpoint pen or felt-tip pen) when filling out the entire form, as pencil or erasable ink is not accepted.

_vision_explanations:Who Is Filing:f88c0.1: This is an instruction, not a field to fill. Use only permanent ink (ballpoint pen or marker) - never pencil or erasable ink when completing this form.
_vision_explanations:Who Is Filing:f88c0.2: This section is only for people who are having someone else (an agent) update their My Number Card address instead of doing it themselves.
_vision_explanations:Who Is Filing:f88c0.3: If using an agent, write your My Number Card PIN in the designated space below this text, then put this form in a sealed envelope for security.
_vision_explanations:Who Is Filing:f88c0.6: This explains that if your agent submits this form on the same day you file your address change notification, your electronic certificate can also be updated simultaneously.

_vision_explanations:Addresses:a091c8ffd.2: This is informational text explaining that if an agent (someone acting on your behalf) submits this form on the same day as a change of address notification, your electronic certificate can be updated simultaneously. No action needed - this is just explaining the process.
_vision_explanations:Addresses:a091c8ffd.3: This continues the explanation that any agent acting on your behalf must bring valid photo ID issued by Japanese government or municipal authorities. No writing required - this is instructional text about required documentation.
_vision_explanations:Addresses:a091c8ffd.4: This completes the list of acceptable ID documents for agents: Residence Card, My Number Card, or Japanese driving license. No input needed - this is just clarifying what types of ID are acceptable.
_vision_explanations:Addresses:a091c8ffd.5: This is the form title indicating this document grants power of attorney specifically for changing resident registration. No writing needed in this field - it's just the form header.
_vision_explanations:Addresses:a091c8ffd.6: This shows the form is addressed to the Mayor of Koto City and indicates this form is for use in Koto City specifically. No action required - this is pre-printed addressing information.

_vision_explanations:Person Table:47f65b.2: This section is for the person who is delegating authority to someone else. If you are giving someone permission to handle your moving notification, your information goes here.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:47f65b.3: This is pre-filled with 'Koto City' indicating this form is specifically for Koto City ward in Tokyo. No need to change this unless you're in a different municipality.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:47f65b.6: Enter your date of birth in year/month/day format (e.g., 1990/03/15) and your phone number with area code, using the dashes as separators.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:47f65b.7: This is explanatory text stating that you're appointing someone as your agent. The actual agent's information would be filled in a section below (not shown in this image).
_vision_explanations:Person Table:47f65b.8: This instruction tells you to check the appropriate boxes below to indicate which type of moving notification your agent can handle on your behalf.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:47f65b.10: This note reminds you that if you have a My Number Card, the address update on that card is included in this moving notification service.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:47f65b.11: Check this box if you're moving to a new address within Koto City and want your agent to handle the notification.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:47f65b.12: Same as field 10 - this is a reminder that My Number Card address updates are included in the within-city moving notification.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:47f65b.13: Check this box if you're moving out of Koto City to another area in Japan or to a foreign country and want your agent to handle the moving-out notification.

_vision_explanations:ID & Documents:dc49.1: Check this box if you are moving out of Koto City to another city in Japan or to a foreign country. This is the most common option for foreign residents who are relocating.
_vision_explanations:ID & Documents:dc49.2: Check this box if you are staying in Koto City but your household composition is changing (someone moving in/out of your current address, marriage, divorce, etc.). Only select this if you're not changing your address but the people living at your residence are changing.

_vision_explanations:Instructions:977346.1: Enter your date of birth in the format YYYY/MM/DD (year/month/day). For example, if you were born on March 15, 1990, write 1990/03/15.
_vision_explanations:Instructions:977346.2: This is an informational note explaining that the PIN/password section below will be securely destroyed after processing. No action needed from you.
_vision_explanations:Instructions:977346.4: Enter your 4-digit PIN for the electronic certificate if you have one set up. Leave blank if you haven't established this certificate yet.
_vision_explanations:Instructions:977346.5: Enter your 4-digit PIN for basic resident registration services. This is typically the same PIN you use at city hall for official procedures.
_vision_explanations:Instructions:977346.6: This continues the security notice from field 2 - no action required. It's explaining the form handling process.
_vision_explanations:Instructions:977346.7: This completes the security notice about shredding. No input needed from you.
_vision_explanations:Instructions:977346.8: This note applies if you've set different PINs for different services - fill in the separate boxes above if your PINs are different. If they're the same, you can leave the individual boxes empty.
_vision_explanations:Instructions:977346.9: This completes the sentence about when shredding occurs. No action needed from you.

_vision_explanations:Footer & Notes:11f0.2: Create a secure password between 6-16 characters using a mix of letters and numbers for your digital signature certificate. This password will be used to authenticate your electronic signature on official documents.
_vision_explanations:Footer & Notes:11f0.3: For each character in your password above, circle 'A' if it's a letter or 'N' if it's a number to help prevent confusion (like mistaking '0' for 'O'). Write all letters in BLOCK CAPITALS in the password field.
_vision_explanations:Footer & Notes:11f0.4: Use the circle indicators above each character position to mark whether that character is an alphabet letter (A) or number (N). This prevents misreading ambiguous characters when your password is processed.
_vision_explanations:Footer & Notes:11f0.6: This appears to be a form reference number (R8.1) - you typically don't need to fill this in as it's pre-printed for administrative purposes.

_vision_explanations:Who Is Filing:38a87.5: This explains that if a family member is acting as your agent to update your residence card, they must bring valid photo ID issued by Japanese government agencies (like a residence card, driver's license, or passport with residence status). Make sure your agent has their official photo ID ready before going to the immigration office on your behalf.

_vision_explanations:Addresses:c1cddc74c.1: This is explanatory text about functional updates requiring photo ID from Japanese government agencies like residence cards, individual number cards, or driver's licenses. No action needed - this is just informational text explaining documentation requirements.
_vision_explanations:Addresses:c1cddc74c.2: This continues the explanation mentioning specific examples of acceptable ID documents. Again, this is informational text that doesn't require any input from you.
_vision_explanations:Addresses:c1cddc74c.3: Write '委託書' (power of attorney) if someone else is submitting this form on your behalf, or the specific type of change you're requesting (like address change). This is the document title/purpose field.
_vision_explanations:Addresses:c1cddc74c.4: Write '致江東区長' (To the Koto Ward Mayor/Chief) or the appropriate ward office you're submitting to. This indicates which municipal office will process your request.
_vision_explanations:Addresses:c1cddc74c.5: Fill in the date you're completing/submitting this form using the Japanese calendar format (年 for year, 月 for month, 日 for day). Convert Western calendar to Japanese era year if required.

_vision_explanations:Instructions:f93839.6: This is an informational notice, not a field to fill out. It explains that after password processing is complete, you don't need to do anything - it's just letting you know what happens next in the process.
_vision_explanations:Instructions:f93839.7: This is also informational text, not a field to fill out. It's explaining that the paper portion below the dotted line will be automatically destroyed by shredding for security purposes after processing.

_vision_explanations:Header & Dates:c73f.1: This section is for registering your move INTO this municipality from another city/prefecture or from abroad. Check this box if you are moving to this area and need to register your new address.
_vision_explanations:Header & Dates:c73f.4: This header indicates important instructions and notes for filling out the form correctly. Read this section carefully as it contains essential guidance on how to properly complete each field and avoid common mistakes.

_vision_explanations:Who Is Filing:06566.3: This is a section header listing important instructions for filling out the form. Read these guidelines carefully before completing any fields to avoid common mistakes.
_vision_explanations:Who Is Filing:06566.7: Enter your phone number in the format shown. Include area code and use half-width numbers; if you don't have a Japanese phone number, you may need to provide an alternative contact method or leave blank depending on the form requirements.

_vision_explanations:Person Table:3970a9.3: This is part of the same informational notice as field 1. No action needed - it's just explaining the requirement to file moving-out paperwork with your previous local government office.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:3970a9.9: Write the name of the elementary school your child will attend in the new area. Contact the local education board beforehand to confirm which school your child should be assigned to based on your new address.

_vision_explanations:Page 2 - Section 1:.1: Fill in all the information within the thick black borders on the form, including personal details, addresses, and family member information. Make sure to write clearly in the designated boxes and fields.
_vision_explanations:Page 2 - Section 1:.2: Complete all required sections of this resident registration form. Use black ink and write legibly in Japanese characters where appropriate.
_vision_explanations:Page 2 - Section 1:.12: If you are moving from another city/prefecture or from overseas, you cannot complete this process by mail - you must visit the municipal office in person after completing your move to submit the proper documentation.

_vision_explanations:Page 3 - Section 1:.11: Enter the date when you are filling out this form or submitting the application. Write the date in Japanese format (year/month/day) using the Japanese calendar year (Reiwa era) or Western calendar as specified on the form.

_vision_explanations:Page 4 - Section 1:.4: Fill in the date you moved out of your previous address in Japan using the format shown (year/month/day). This applies when you've moved from another municipality to your current one.
_vision_explanations:Page 4 - Section 1:.8: Check this box and fill in relevant details if you're moving to a new address within the same city/municipality. This is for local moves that don't cross municipal boundaries.

_vision_explanations:Page 4 - Section 2:.2: This section is only filled out if you are moving into the municipality from another city/country or moving to a new address within the same municipality. Leave this blank if you are registering at your current address for the first time without any move involved.

_vision_explanations:Page 5 - Section 1:.1: Check the appropriate box to indicate whether you are moving into Setagaya City, moving out of Setagaya City, or moving within Setagaya City. This determines the type of address change notification you are filing.
_vision_explanations:Page 5 - Section 1:.2: Write 'Setagaya City' (世田谷区) as this form is specifically for address changes involving Setagaya ward in Tokyo. This field identifies the municipal jurisdiction handling your registration.
_vision_explanations:Page 5 - Section 1:.12: Write your date of birth in the format shown (year/month/day), using the Western calendar. Make sure this matches exactly what appears on your residence card or other official documents.
_vision_explanations:Page 5 - Section 1:.14: Write your name in Roman alphabet letters exactly as it appears on your residence card (zairyu card). Do not use katakana or any other script - only the English alphabet spelling from your official residence status documents.

_vision_explanations:Page 5 - Section 2:.1: Write your date of birth in the format shown on the form (likely YYYY/MM/DD or DD/MM/YYYY). Use the exact date that appears on your residence card to ensure consistency.
_vision_explanations:Page 5 - Section 2:.3: Write your name exactly as it appears in alphabet letters on your residence card, including any middle names or initials. Do not translate or modify the spelling in any way.
_vision_explanations:Page 5 - Section 2:.5: Write your date of birth in the same format as field 1. This should match exactly what is written on your residence card and other official documents.
_vision_explanations:Page 5 - Section 2:.8: Enter your name in alphabet letters exactly as shown on your residence card. Make sure the spelling, spacing, and capitalization match your residence card perfectly.
_vision_explanations:Page 5 - Section 2:.10: Check this section if you are moving into the municipality from another city/prefecture or from abroad, or if you are moving within the same municipality. Select the appropriate option based on your situation.
_vision_explanations:Page 5 - Section 2:.11: Write your date of birth using the same format as the previous date fields. Ensure it matches your residence card and passport information exactly.
_vision_explanations:Page 5 - Section 2:.12: Check this section if you are submitting this form by mail or through other non-direct methods rather than visiting the office in person. Follow any additional instructions for postal submissions.
_vision_explanations:Page 5 - Section 2:.14: Write your name in alphabet letters exactly as it appears on your residence card. Double-check for accuracy as this must match your official documentation precisely.

_vision_explanations:Page 5 - Section 2:.1: Write your date of birth in the Japanese format, which is typically year/month/day (YYYY/MM/DD) or may use the Japanese era calendar system. If unsure about the format, check other sections of the form for examples or ask the office staff for clarification on whether to use Western calendar or Japanese era years.

_vision_explanations:Page 5 - Section 3:.1: Check the appropriate box if you are moving from another city/country or moving within the same municipality. Leave blank if this is your first registration or if neither situation applies to you.
_vision_explanations:Page 5 - Section 3:.2: Write your date of birth in the Japanese format: year/month/day (YYYY/MM/DD). Use the Western calendar year, not the Japanese era year.

_vision_explanations:Page 5 - Section 3:.5: Write your name exactly as it appears on your residence card using Roman alphabet letters. Match the spelling, capitalization, and spacing exactly.
_vision_explanations:Page 5 - Section 3:.7: Write your date of birth in the Japanese format: year/month/day (YYYY/MM/DD). Use the Western calendar year, not the Japanese era year.
_vision_explanations:Page 5 - Section 3:.8: Write your name exactly as it appears on your residence card using Roman alphabet letters. Match the spelling, capitalization, and spacing exactly.

_vision_explanations:Who Is Filing:1b381.15: This indicates 'Page B' or the back side of the form. If you're filling out a multi-page form, this helps you identify which section you're working on - typically you would flip the form over to complete the B side after finishing the A side.

_vision_explanations:Who Is Filing:a2a6d.3: This is a section marked 'For office use only' (ーカ記入更の) - do not write anything in this area as it will be filled out by government staff when they process your form.

_vision_explanations:Addresses:f1614de53.2: Leave this field blank - it's marked '記入更の' (for office use only) and will be filled in by government staff.
_vision_explanations:Addresses:f1614de53.7: Leave this field blank - this is an administrative code (8801--住国記保職職権消除) that only government officials can fill in regarding residence record maintenance.
_vision_explanations:Addresses:f1614de53.9: This appears to be part of instructional text ('くだ' meaning 'please') rather than a field to fill out, so no action needed.

_vision_explanations:Person Table:6d5fff.8: This is a checklist section where you mark applicable boxes - carefully review each item and check all that apply to your situation.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:6d5fff.11: Fill in the date using the Japanese calendar system (Heisei era) - for recent dates, convert from Western calendar (e.g., 2019 = Heisei 31). Check the appropriate gender box and employment status.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:6d5fff.13: Check the boxes for required supporting documents you're submitting, such as residence certificate, passport copy, or insurance documents - make sure you have all checked documents ready to submit with this form.

_vision_explanations:Person Table:92757e.8: Write 'てく' (teku) which appears to be a pre-printed field label or instruction on the form. As a foreign resident, you don't need to write anything in this field as it's likely just a form identifier or processing code.

_vision_explanations:Person Table:0f97fe.5: Write the name of your local ward citizens affairs office (区民事務所) or national health insurance division where you're submitting this form. You can find this information on your residence card or by checking your ward's website.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:0f97fe.12: These appear to be bullet points for additional notes or specifications related to the form sections above. Leave blank unless you have specific additional information that doesn't fit in other designated fields.

_vision_explanations:Person Table:c6184c.8: This is an informational notice section that explains important details about the form or process - you typically don't need to write anything here, just read the information provided. It often contains instructions about deadlines, required documents, or what happens after submission.

_vision_explanations:ID & Documents:816e.5: This is a notice section where you would write any additional information or special circumstances that need to be communicated to the authorities. Leave blank if there are no special notices or additional information to provide.

_vision_explanations:Person Table:3fd985.1: Write your relationship to the household head in this field, such as '妻' (wife), '夫' (husband), '子' (child), '父' (father), '母' (mother), etc. If you are the household head yourself, you can leave this blank or write '本人' (self).

_vision_explanations:ID & Documents:a8c9.1: Write your relationship to the head of household in parentheses, such as (配偶者) for spouse, (子) for child, or (本人) if you are the head of household yourself.

_vision_explanations:Instructions:0e9d8c.1: Write the year when your employment insurance qualification began (using Japanese era year format, specifically Heisei era since it states 'Heisei 4年4月1日以降' meaning April 1, 1992 or later).
_vision_explanations:Instructions:0e9d8c.2: Enter the month and day when your employment insurance qualification began - this appears to be April 1st based on the form structure.
_vision_explanations:Instructions:0e9d8c.3: Enter the離職理由コード (reason for leaving work code) - this should be '11' or '12' based on your specific circumstances for leaving your job, which determines your unemployment benefit eligibility.

_vision_explanations:Footer & Notes:1a55.2: Write your postal code with the 3-digit portion in the first box and 4-digit portion in the second box (e.g., 100-0001).
_vision_explanations:Footer & Notes:1a55.3: This appears to be a continuation or overflow field - use it if you need additional space for information that didn't fit in previous sections of the form.

_vision_explanations:Header & Dates:d5bc.8: This is just a label indicating 'Entry Example' - it marks a section that shows you how to properly fill out the form fields, so refer to it for formatting guidance.

_vision_explanations:Header & Dates:0f63.4: This appears to be the beginning of an instructional text explaining when this form should be used, specifically when a national health insurance enrollee obtains a residence certificate. This is not a field to fill out, but rather explanatory text you should read to understand if this form applies to your situation.

_vision_explanations:Who Is Filing:d5730.11: Enter your phone number in the format shown, with area code in parentheses if applicable. For mobile phones, you can omit the parentheses and write the number directly.
_vision_explanations:Who Is Filing:d5730.13: Check this box if you want official documents and correspondence related to this form to be mailed to your registered address instead of being available for pickup.

_vision_explanations:Addresses:116f7eb3d.3: Write your phone number in the format shown with parentheses around the area code, such as 03(1234)5678 for Tokyo numbers or 06(7890)1234 for Osaka numbers.
_vision_explanations:Addresses:116f7eb3d.5: Check this box if you want official documents and correspondence related to this form to be mailed to your registered address rather than picked up in person.

_vision_explanations:Addresses:09e246662.4: Leave this field blank - it's for administrative use by government staff to track document collection or processing status.
_vision_explanations:Addresses:09e246662.12: Leave this field blank - it's for the government office to stamp or mark which counter/window processed your application.

_vision_explanations:Addresses:4ef399594.4: This field indicates whether documents or items have been collected or not. If you have uncollected mail, packages, or official documents from government offices, mark this field accordingly - it helps track delivery status for administrative purposes.

_vision_explanations:Person Table:f7275e.12: Check this box if you have not yet collected your health insurance card from the municipal office. Leave blank if you have already received your card or if this doesn't apply to your situation.

_vision_explanations:Person Table:28ee19.11: These are bullet point markers in a list format - you don't need to write anything here, they're just visual formatting elements to separate different options or sections.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:28ee19.13: This field indicates 'Not collected' status - it's likely pre-printed text or a checkbox option that would be marked by officials if certain documents or information couldn't be collected during processing.

_vision_explanations:Person Table:54e23e.14: Write the name of your company or employer here in Japanese characters. If you're self-employed, write your business name or just indicate your occupation.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:54e23e.15: Write your company's phone number in the format shown, with area code in parentheses followed by the main number. Use Japanese number formatting conventions (hyphens between number groups).

_vision_explanations:Header & Dates:d707.5: Enter your household identification number (世帯番号) which should be provided by your local ward office or found on previous documents from them.

_vision_explanations:Who Is Filing:24cc9.2: Write your household identification number (世帯番号) which is assigned by your local municipal office when you register for National Health Insurance.
_vision_explanations:Who Is Filing:24cc9.5: Select your relationship to the head of household - '本人' means you are the head of household yourself, which is the most common selection for individual applicants.
_vision_explanations:Who Is Filing:24cc9.7: Write the full name of the person filing this form - typically your own name if you selected '本人' in field 5, using the same characters as registered with your municipality.

_vision_explanations:Person Table:5f14dc.12: This indicates the person's relationship to the head of household. '本人' means 'self' and is pre-selected, indicating this row is for the head of household (typically the main resident listed on the form).
_vision_explanations:Person Table:5f14dc.13: These black circles (●●) represent fields where you fill in specific numbers or dates by darkening the appropriate circles, similar to a bubble sheet test format used in Japanese official forms.

_vision_explanations:Person Table:873218.2: Write the birth year using the Japanese era system (昭和/平成/令和) followed by the year number. Foreign residents can convert their birth year - for example, 1990 would be 平成2年.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:873218.3: Write your full name in katakana if you're a foreign resident, matching exactly how it appears on your residence card. Japanese citizens write their name in kanji/hiragana as it appears on official documents.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:873218.5: Write the birth year in Japanese era format, same as field 2. Make sure it matches your official documents and residence card information.

_vision_explanations:ID & Documents:59f1.12: This is explanatory text stating that My Number Cards must be valid and within their expiration date, with electronic certificates requiring renewal every 5 years. No action is required from you for this field - it's just an important notice to ensure your My Number Card is current.

_vision_explanations:ID & Documents:53b9.1: This is a notice or information field where you would write any important notifications or announcements related to your status changes (such as social insurance enrollment/withdrawal or national health insurance changes). If there are no special notices to report, you can leave this blank or write '特になし' (nothing in particular).

_vision_explanations:Instructions:64891f.6: Check the appropriate box if you moved into or out of the municipality during the period covered by this form. For foreign residents, this includes moves from abroad or to other cities within Japan.
_vision_explanations:Instructions:64891f.11: Check this if there were changes to your household composition, such as family members joining or leaving, or changes in who is registered as the head of household.
_vision_explanations:Instructions:64891f.15: This indicates which service window at the city office you should visit - check the appropriate box based on your district or the type of service you need.

_vision_explanations:Instructions:61be11.1: Leave these fields blank unless specifically instructed by the municipal office. These are administrative codes used by staff for special cases like restoring registration rights or noting relocations within the same city.
_vision_explanations:Instructions:61be11.2: This field is filled out by the government office staff member handling your case. As an applicant, you should leave this blank - the clerk will write their name or ID number here.

_vision_explanations:Instructions:d33b9b.1: This indicates the type of notification you're requesting - select '確認書' (confirmation document) if you need written proof of your registration status, or 'お知らせ' (notice) for general notifications.
_vision_explanations:Instructions:d33b9b.8: Select '入力' (input) to indicate you are manually filling out this form rather than having it processed through special delivery (特) or regular mail (普) methods.

_vision_explanations:Footer & Notes:5729.6: This is a confirmation checkbox or signature field where you acknowledge that all the information provided on the form is accurate and complete. Simply check the box or sign your name to confirm the details you've entered are correct.

_vision_explanations:Footer & Notes:099a.2: This appears to be a processing field marked as '入力' (Input) that may be filled by office staff rather than the applicant. As a foreign resident, you likely don't need to write anything in this administrative processing section unless specifically instructed by the office personnel.

_vision_explanations:Header & Dates:8e1e.1: This is a form header indicating this is official government Form No. 1 related to National Health Insurance - you don't need to fill anything in this section as it's just the form identification.
_vision_explanations:Header & Dates:8e1e.2: This is an informational notice stating that insurance premium payments are made by automatic bank transfer as a general rule - no action needed, just be aware you'll need to set up automatic payments from your bank account.

_vision_explanations:Who Is Filing:84a8f.6: Check the appropriate box for your situation: '転入' if you're moving from another area, '既存口座情報' if you have existing account information to transfer. Foreign residents moving from overseas would typically check the '転入' option and may need to indicate '都外' (from outside Tokyo) or provide documentation about previous residence.

_vision_explanations:Who Is Filing:a905c.1: This appears to be a checkbox or field related to a 20% proportion or 2/10 ratio, likely referring to a partial benefit amount, contribution rate, or coverage percentage. Check this option if you qualify for or are selecting a 20% rate for whatever benefit or service this form covers.

_vision_explanations:Addresses:3f5e64198.2: This indicates a 20% co-payment rate for health insurance. If this applies to you, mark or check this option - it's the standard rate for most working adults in Japan.
_vision_explanations:Addresses:3f5e64198.14: This is a blank field within parentheses where you should write additional information as specified by the context. Check the surrounding text or instructions to determine what specific details are required here.

_vision_explanations:Addresses:40823c171.9: Select '2割' (20%) if you pay 20% of medical costs, which is the standard rate for most working-age adults (ages 20-69) with regular income.
_vision_explanations:Addresses:40823c171.13: This appears to be a reference marker for 'Box 2' rather than a field to fill out - it likely corresponds to another section of the form where you would provide additional details about your household composition or income.

_vision_explanations:Addresses:d30d043a8.3: This field relates to collection/payment transfer status. If you have outstanding payments or debts being transferred between agencies, mark '済' (completed) if already handled or '不要' (not required) if it doesn't apply to you. Most regular residents would mark '不要' unless specifically told otherwise by the government office.

_vision_explanations:Person Table:7e39c5.2: This field indicates the status of collection transfer procedures. Most individual applicants can mark '不要' (Not Required) unless specifically instructed otherwise by the municipal office.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:7e39c5.14: This indicates a 20% co-payment rate for healthcare services. This percentage is typically pre-printed based on your age and income level, so you usually don't need to fill this in yourself.

_vision_explanations:Person Table:c789b2.8: Check this if the household head is 75 years old or older and eligible for the elderly medical care system (後期高齢者医療制度). Leave blank if the head is younger than 75.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:c789b2.10: If you have national health insurance, write '国保' (kokuho) in the parentheses. This refers to the National Health Insurance system that many foreign residents use.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:c789b2.15: You can skip filling this section if you already provided the same information in the section above it. This note helps avoid duplicate data entry.

_vision_explanations:Person Table:32d1a6.14: This appears to be a blank field for additional information or notes related to the person's registration details. Leave blank unless specifically instructed to fill in particular information by the municipal office or if there are special circumstances that need to be noted.

_vision_explanations:ID & Documents:7f1f.3: Write the specific qualification or certification you hold that's relevant to your profession or status in Japan, such as your work visa category or professional license.

_vision_explanations:Header & Dates:585d.1: This is a form identifier that should already be pre-printed on the form - you don't need to fill this in. It indicates this is the official Form No. 9 for National Health Insurance termination procedures.
_vision_explanations:Header & Dates:585d.2: Write the name of your municipal ward or district office where you're submitting this form. This should match the office location where you received the form.
_vision_explanations:Header & Dates:585d.3: Enter today's date when you're filling out and submitting the form, in Japanese date format (year/month/day). You can use either the Japanese imperial calendar year or Western calendar year.
_vision_explanations:Header & Dates:585d.4: Write the full official name of the mayor of your city, ward, or town. You can ask the office staff for the correct name and title if you're unsure.
_vision_explanations:Header & Dates:585d.5: Check either 'Total Loss' if you're losing all health insurance coverage, or 'Partial Loss' if only some family members are affected. Most individual applicants will check 'Total Loss'.
_vision_explanations:Header & Dates:585d.6: Enter the date when your National Health Insurance coverage will end or ended, typically the day you leave Japan or start new employment with different insurance.
_vision_explanations:Header & Dates:585d.7: Write your district or neighborhood code and address number as it appears on your residence registration. This is the same addressing system used on your residence card.
_vision_explanations:Header & Dates:585d.8: This section is for your new insurance certificate number if you're switching to different insurance rather than completely terminating coverage.

_vision_explanations:Addresses:02124c52d.7: This appears to be a blank space for additional information or notes related to your application. Leave blank unless you have specific circumstances that require explanation.
_vision_explanations:Addresses:02124c52d.8: This is option 5 for reason of change - select this only if reporting a death of the insurance holder or dependent, which results in loss of coverage the day after death. Most foreign residents would not select this option unless filing on behalf of a deceased person's family.

_vision_explanations:Addresses:1596467c9.5: This appears to be a section header or box identifier - you typically don't need to write anything here as it's a form reference number.
_vision_explanations:Addresses:1596467c9.9: Fill in the specific details requested by the preceding text or category. Check the context around this field to determine what information is needed (could be address details, phone number, etc.).
_vision_explanations:Addresses:1596467c9.12: This is an administrative note indicating the form will be transferred to the revenue/tax collection department - no action needed from you as the applicant.

_vision_explanations:Person Table:e3025b.1: This appears to be a blank field for additional notes or remarks related to the person's information. Leave blank unless you have specific additional information that doesn't fit in other sections of the form.
_vision_explanations:Person Table:e3025b.4: This is an administrative section indicating transfer to the revenue collection department - this is typically filled out by government staff, not by applicants, so you should leave this blank.

_vision_explanations:Person Table:3ee08c.4: Write the specific reason for the change or update you're making to your residence record, such as '転入' (moving in), '転出' (moving out), '転居' (change of address within same city), or '世帯変更' (household composition change). This field explains the purpose of your visit to the municipal office and what type of registration change you need processed.

_vision_explanations:Person Table:9441af.10: Check this box if you want your documents to be collected at the general service counter rather than having them mailed to you. This is useful if you prefer to pick up important documents in person or have concerns about mail delivery to your address.

_vision_explanations:ID & Documents:0ff6.4: Check this box if you are planning to move out of your current address/municipality. This is typically used when you need to notify the government of an upcoming relocation before it happens.
_vision_explanations:ID & Documents:0ff6.5: This indicates the processing method - leave blank as this section is for office use only. Government staff will mark whether the application was processed at the counter, by staff, or through an outsourced service.

08a1c5434aa3b7f2372ed86cb19d6629.note: Matched: 国民健康保険, 資格

_vision_explanations:Page 1 - Section 1:.3: This is a header for the information coordination section of the form - no action needed from you as it's just a label for the administrative processing area below.
_vision_explanations:Page 1 - Section 1:.9: Check one of the boxes to indicate the confirmation status: □ エラー (Error) if there were issues with verification, or □ 未反映 (Not Reflected) if the information hasn't been processed yet - this is typically filled by the office staff, not the applicant.

_vision_explanations:Page 1 - Section 2:.7: This indicates 'Page B' or the back side of the form. No writing is needed here - this is just a reference marker for the form structure.
_vision_explanations:Page 1 - Section 2:.10: This is an 'office use only' section for official record updates. Leave this blank as it will be filled by government staff processing your application.
_vision_explanations:Page 1 - Section 2:.15: This appears to be an official code (8801) related to residence record maintenance and deletion authority. This is for administrative use only - do not write anything in this field as it's handled by immigration officials.

_vision_explanations:Page 1 - Section 2:.2: This appears to be part of a polite request phrase in Japanese, likely 'kudasai' (please). You don't need to fill this in as it's pre-printed text that's part of the form's instructions or request language.

_vision_explanations:Page 1 - Section 3:.1: This appears to be part of instructional text that says 'please' - likely indicating you should fill out the form carefully or follow the instructions provided. As a foreign resident, simply follow the guidance given in the surrounding text for completing this section of the form.

_vision_explanations:Page 1 - Section 4:.7: This is a checklist section - review and check off the boxes for required documents or conditions that apply to your situation before submitting the form.
_vision_explanations:Page 1 - Section 4:.10: Enter the date in Japanese calendar format (Heisei era), specify gender (male/female), and indicate employment status such as part-time work or other occupation type.
_vision_explanations:Page 1 - Section 4:.12: Check the appropriate boxes to indicate reasons for record changes (acquisition/loss) and attach required supporting documents like qualification certificates or notification forms as specified.

_vision_explanations:Page 1 - Section 5:.7: This appears to be part of a checkbox or selection field related to personal information categories. As a foreign resident, you would typically check the appropriate box based on your specific situation or the type of documentation you're providing, following the instructions given in the form or by the office staff.

_vision_explanations:Page 1 - Section 5:.4: Write the name of your local ward citizens affairs office (区民事務所) where you plan to submit this form or handle your national health insurance matters. You can find this information by checking your ward's website or calling your local government office to confirm which office serves your address.

_vision_explanations:Page 1 - Section 6:.2: Write the name of your local ward citizens affairs office or the national health insurance division where you're submitting this form. You can find this information on previous correspondence from your ward office or by checking your ward's website.
_vision_explanations:Page 1 - Section 6:.9: These appear to be selection dots/checkboxes for choosing between options. Mark the appropriate dot based on the context of the question being asked in this section.

_vision_explanations:Page 1 - Section 6:.5: This is a notification/notice section that typically contains important instructions or information about the form. You should read this carefully as it may contain specific guidance about required documents, deadlines, or special procedures that apply to your situation as a foreign resident.

_vision_explanations:Addresses:6e40da921.4: Check '有' (yes) if you have children, spouse, or parents moving with you, or '無' (no) if moving alone. If you check the phone contact option, the office will call you after processing your move-out procedures.
_vision_explanations:Addresses:6e40da921.5: This note explains that you'll need to present your residence card at your new municipality when completing move-in procedures - no action required in this field, it's just informational text.
